text: Sandagdorj Handsuren (born 5 May 1940) is a Mongolian chess player who holds the title of Woman International Master (WIM, 1972). She is a winner of the Mongolian Women's Chess Championship (1968). ==Biography== From the 1960s to the 1970s Sandagdorj Handsuren was one of the leading Mongolian women's chess players. In 1968, she won Mongolian Women's Chess Championship. In 1961, Sandagdorj Handsuren participated at Women's World Chess Championship Candidates Tournament in Vrnjačka Banja and ranked 17th place. Sandagdorj Handsuren played for Mongolia in the Women's Chess Olympiads: * In 1963, at second board in the 2nd Chess Olympiad (women) in Split (+5, =1, -8), * In 1972, at second board in the 5th Chess Olympiad (women) in Skopje (+2, =3, -4). In 1972, she awarded the FIDE International Women Master (WIM) title. ==References== ==External links== * *Sandagdorj Handsuren chess games at 365Chess.com Category:1940 births Category:Sportspeople from Ulaanbaatar Category:Mongolian female chess players Category:Chess woman International Masters Category:Chess Olympiad competitors Category:Living people
title: Sandagdorj Handsuren
